fields.name: source
fields.description: Get an infrastructure data source by id

fields.name: allSources
fields.description: Get a list of all infrastructure data sources

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: InfraSource
types.description: A source of infrastructure data

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the source

fields.name: configuration
fields.description: The raw configuration of the source

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the source

fields.name: capabilitiesByNode
fields.description: A hierarchy of capabilities available on nodes

fields.name: logEntriesAround
fields.description: A consecutive span of log entries surrounding a point in time

args.name: key
args.description: The sort key that corresponds to the point in time

args.name: countBefore
args.description: The maximum number of preceding to return

args.name: countAfter
args.description: The maximum number of following to return

args.name: filterQuery
args.description: The query to filter the log entries by

args.name: highlightQuery
args.description: The query to highlight the log entries with

fields.name: logEntriesBetween
fields.description: A consecutive span of log entries within an interval

args.name: startKey
args.description: The sort key that corresponds to the start of the interval

args.name: endKey
args.description: The sort key that corresponds to the end of the interval

args.name: filterQuery
args.description: The query to filter the log entries by

args.name: highlightQuery
args.description: The query to highlight the log entries with

fields.name: logSummaryBetween
fields.description: A consecutive span of summary buckets within an interval

args.name: start
args.description: The millisecond timestamp that corresponds to the start of the interval

args.name: end
args.description: The millisecond timestamp that corresponds to the end of the interval

args.name: bucketSize
args.description: The size of each bucket in milliseconds

args.name: filterQuery
args.description: The query to filter the log entries by

fields.name: map
fields.description: A hierarchy of hosts, pods, containers, services or arbitrary groups

types.name: InfraSourceConfiguration
types.description: A set of configuration options for an infrastructure data source

fields.name: metricAlias
fields.description: The alias to read metric data from

fields.name: logAlias
fields.description: The alias to read log data from

fields.name: fields
fields.description: The field mapping to use for this source

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: InfraSourceFields
types.description: A mapping of semantic fields to their document counterparts

fields.name: container
fields.description: The field to identify a container by

fields.name: host
fields.description: The fields to identify a host by

fields.name: message
fields.description: The fields that may contain the log event message. The first field found win.

fields.name: pod
fields.description: The field to identify a pod by

fields.name: tiebreaker
fields.description: The field to use as a tiebreaker for log events that have identical timestamps

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The field to use as a timestamp for metrics and logs

types.name: InfraSourceStatus
types.description: The status of an infrastructure data source

fields.name: metricAliasExists
fields.description: Whether the configured metric alias exists

fields.name: logAliasExists
fields.description: Whether the configured log alias exists

fields.name: metricIndicesExist
fields.description: Whether the configured alias or wildcard pattern resolve to any metric indices

fields.name: logIndicesExist
fields.description: Whether the configured alias or wildcard pattern resolve to any log indices

fields.name: metricIndices
fields.description: The list of indices in the metric alias

fields.name: logIndices
fields.description: The list of indices in the log alias

fields.name: indexFields
fields.description: The list of fields defined in the index mappings

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: InfraIndexField
types.description: A descriptor of a field in an index

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the field

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the field's values as recognized by Kibana

fields.name: searchable
fields.description: Whether the field's values can be efficiently searched for

fields.name: aggregatable
fields.description: Whether the field's values can be aggregated

types.name: InfraNodeCapability
types.description: One specific capability available on a node. A capability corresponds to a fileset or metricset

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: InfraLogEntryInterval
types.description: A consecutive sequence of log entries

fields.name: start
fields.description: The key corresponding to the start of the interval covered by the entries

fields.name: end
fields.description: The key corresponding to the end of the interval covered by the entries

fields.name: hasMoreBefore
fields.description: Whether there are more log entries available before the start

fields.name: hasMoreAfter
fields.description: Whether there are more log entries available after the end

fields.name: filterQuery
fields.description: The query the log entries were filtered by

fields.name: highlightQuery
fields.description: The query the log entries were highlighted with

fields.name: entries
fields.description: A list of the log entries

types.name: InfraTimeKey
types.description: A representation of the log entry's position in the event stream

fields.name: time
fields.description: The timestamp of the event that the log entry corresponds to

fields.name: tiebreaker
fields.description: The tiebreaker that disambiguates events with the same timestamp

types.name: InfraLogEntry
types.description: A log entry

fields.name: key
fields.description: A unique representation of the log entry's position in the event stream

fields.name: gid
fields.description: The log entry's id

fields.name: source
fields.description: The source id

fields.name: message
fields.description: A list of the formatted log entry segments

types.name: InfraLogMessageSegment
types.description: A segment of the log entry message

types.name: InfraLogMessageFieldSegment
types.description: A segment of the log entry message that was derived from a field

fields.name: field
fields.description: The field the segment was derived from

fields.name: value
fields.description: The segment's message

fields.name: highlights
fields.description: A list of highlighted substrings of the value

types.name: InfraLogMessageConstantSegment
types.description: A segment of the log entry message that was derived from a field

fields.name: constant
fields.description: The segment's message

types.name: InfraLogSummaryInterval
types.description: A consecutive sequence of log summary buckets

fields.name: start
fields.description: The millisecond timestamp corresponding to the start of the interval covered by the summary

fields.name: end
fields.description: The millisecond timestamp corresponding to the end of the interval covered by the summary

fields.name: filterQuery
fields.description: The query the log entries were filtered by

fields.name: buckets
fields.description: A list of the log entries

types.name: InfraLogSummaryBucket
types.description: A log summary bucket

fields.name: start
fields.description: The start timestamp of the bucket

fields.name: end
fields.description: The end timestamp of the bucket

fields.name: entriesCount
fields.description: The number of entries inside the bucket

inputFields.name: interval
inputFields.description: The interval string to use for last bucket. The format is '{value}{unit}'. For example '5m' would return the metrics for the last 5 minutes of the timespan.

inputFields.name: label
inputFields.description: The label to use in the results for the group by for the terms group by

inputFields.name: field
inputFields.description: The field to group by from a terms aggregation, this is ignored by the filter type

inputFields.name: filters
inputFields.description: The fitlers for the filter group by

types.name: InfraPathFilterInput
types.description: A group by filter

inputFields.name: label
inputFields.description: The label for the filter, this will be used as the group name in the final results

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
